EquidistantTest.cpp

00001 /**
00002  * \file EquidistantTest.cpp
00003  * \brief Command line utility for azimuthal equidistant and Cassini-Soldner
00004  * projections
00005  *
00006  * Copyright (c) Charles Karney (2009, 2010) <charles@karney.com>
00007  * and licensed under the LGPL.  For more information, see
00008  * http://geographiclib.sourceforge.net/
00009  *
00010  * Compile with -I../include and link with Geodesic.o AzimuthalEquidistant.o
00011  * CassiniSoldner.o
00012  *
00013  * See \ref equidistanttest for usage information.
00014  **********************************************************************/
00015 
00016 #include "GeographicLib/Geodesic.hpp"
00017 #include "GeographicLib/AzimuthalEquidistant.hpp"
00018 #include "GeographicLib/CassiniSoldner.hpp"
00019 #include <iostream>
00020 #include <iomanip>
00021 #include <sstream>
00022 
00023 int usage(int retval) {
00024   ( retval ? std::cerr : std::cout ) <<
00025 "Usage: EquidistantTest [-c lat0 lon0] [-z lat0 lon0] [-r] [-h]\n\
00026 $Id: EquidistantTest.cpp 6785 2010-01-05 22:15:42Z karney $\n\
00027 \n\
00028 Convert geodetic coordinates to either azimuthal equidistant or\n\
00029 Cassini-Soldner coordinates.  The center of the projection (lat0, lon0)\n\
00030 is specified by either the -c option (for Cassini-Soldner) or -z option\n\
00031 (for azimuthal equidistant).  At least one of these options must be\n\
00032 given (the last one given is used).  The WGS84 model of the earth is\n\
00033 used.\n\
00034 \n\
00035 Geodetic coordinates are provided on standard input as a set of lines\n\
00036 containing (blank separated) latitude and longitude (decimal degrees).\n\
00037 For each set of geodetic coordinates, the corresponding projected\n\
00038 coordinates x, y (meters) are printed on standard output together with\n\
00039 the azimuth azi (degrees) and reciprocal scale rk.  For Cassini-Soldner,\n\
00040 azi is the bearing of the easting direction and the scale in the\n\
00041 northing direction is 1/rk.  For azimuthal equidistant, azi is the\n\
00042 bearing of the radial direction and the scale in the azimuthal direction\n\
00043 is 1/rk.\n\
00044 \n\
00045 If -r is given the reverse transformation is performed.  x and y are\n\
00046 given on standard input and each line of the standard output gives\n\
00047 latitude, longitude, azi, and rk.\n\
00048 \n\
00049 -h prints this help.\n";
00050   return retval;
00051 }
00052 
00053 int main(int argc, char* argv[]) {
00054   using namespace GeographicLib;
00055   typedef Math::real real;
00056   bool azimuthal = false, cassini = false, reverse = false;
00057   real lat0 = 0, lon0 = 0;
00058   for (int m = 1; m < argc; ++m) {
00059     std::string arg = std::string(argv[m]);
00060     if (arg == "-r")
00061       reverse = true;
00062     else if (arg == "-c" || arg == "-z") {
00063       cassini = arg == "-c";
00064       azimuthal = arg != "-c";
00065       for (unsigned i = 0; i < 2; ++i) {
00066         if (++m == argc) return usage(1);
00067         std::string a = std::string(argv[m]);
00068         std::istringstream str(a);
00069         if (!(str >> (i ? lon0 : lat0))) return usage(1);
00070       }
00071     } else
00072       return usage(arg != "-h");
00073   }
00074 
00075   if (!(azimuthal || cassini)) {
00076     std::cerr << "Must specify \"-c lat lon\" or \"-z lat lon\"\n";
00077     return 1;
00078   }
00079 
00080   if ( !(-90 <= lat0 && lat0 <= 90) ) {
00081     std::cerr << "Latitude not in range [-90, 90]\n";
00082     return 1;
00083   } else if ( !(-180 <= lon0 && lon0 <= 360) ) {
00084     std::cerr << "Longitude not in range [-180, 360]\n";
00085     return 1;
00086   }
00087 
00088   const GeographicLib::CassiniSoldner cs = cassini ?
00089     GeographicLib::CassiniSoldner(lat0, lon0, GeographicLib::Geodesic::WGS84) :
00090     GeographicLib::CassiniSoldner(GeographicLib::Geodesic::WGS84);
00091   const GeographicLib::AzimuthalEquidistant az(GeographicLib::Geodesic::WGS84);
00092 
00093   std::string s;
00094   int retval = 0;
00095   std::cout << std::setprecision(16);
00096   while (std::getline(std::cin, s)) {
00097     try {
00098       std::istringstream str(s);
00099       real lat, lon, x, y, a, m;
00100       if (!(reverse ?
00101             (str >> x >> y) :
00102             (str >> lat >> lon)))
00103         throw GeographicErr("Incomplete input: " + s);
00104       std::string strc;
00105       if (str >> strc)
00106         throw GeographicErr("Extraneous input: " + strc);
00107       if (reverse) {
00108         if (cassini)
00109           cs.Reverse(x, y, lat, lon, a, m);
00110         else
00111           az.Reverse(lat0, lon0, x, y, lat, lon, a, m);
00112         std::cout << lat << " " << lon << " " << a << " " << m << "\n";
00113       } else {
00114         if ( !(-90 <= lat && lat <= 90) )
00115           throw GeographicErr("Latitude not in range [-90, 90]");
00116         if ( !(-180 <= lon && lat <= 360) )
00117           throw GeographicErr("Longitude not in range [-180, 360]");
00118         if (cassini)
00119           cs.Forward(lat, lon, x, y, a, m);
00120         else
00121           az.Forward(lat0, lon0, lat, lon, x, y, a, m);
00122         std::cout << x << " " << y << " " << a << " " << m << "\n";
00123       }
00124     }
00125     catch (const std::exception& e) {
00126       std::cout << "ERROR: " << e.what() << "\n";
00127       retval = 1;
00128     }
00129   }
00130 
00131   return retval;
00132 }
